# Intro 

For today's lab assignment I will be using the Tidy Tuesday data on San Francisco Trees from 2020-01-28

# Load Libraries 
```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(here)
library(maps)
library(mapdata)
library(mapproj)
library(ggplot2)
```

# Load Data 
```{r, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
# Get the Data

sf_trees <- readr::read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2020/2020-01-28/sf_trees.csv')

tuesdata <- tidytuesdayR::tt_load('2020-01-28') 
tuesdata <- tidytuesdayR::tt_load(2020, week = 5)


sf_trees <- tuesdata$sf_trees

states <- map_data("state") %>% 
  filter(region == "california")

county <- map_data("county") %>% 
  filter(region == "california") %>% 
  filter(subregion == "san francisco") 



Sftree <- sf_trees %>% 
  select(tree_id, species, latitude, longitude) %>% 
  filter(longitude <= '-125') %>% 
  filter(latitude >= '37.6') %>% 
 # filter(tree_id >= 3000 & tree_id <= 5000) 
  filter(species == "Prunus serrulata 'Kwanzan' :: Kwanzan Flowering Cherry") #%>% 
 #filter(tree_id == '3000' | tree_id == '4500')

```
# Make a Map 
```{r SFTrees, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
ggplot() +
  geom_polygon(data = county, aes(x =long, 
                                  y= lat, 
                                  group= group),
               color = "black",
               fill= "transparent") +
  geom_point(data= Sftree, aes(x= longitude, 
                               y= latitude,
                               color = species)) +
  guides(color=FALSE) +
  labs(x= "Longitude", y= "Latitude", title = "Tree Species Scattered Throughout San Francisco",
       subtitle = "Kwanzan Flowering Cherry") +
  theme_light() +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5),
        plot.subtitle=element_text(hjust=0.5)) 
 

```
